item.title: Quick question
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

yakman:

Math.random() uses the Random class, so whats the difference between your method Apoc, and the method he already had

According to the documentation, the first call to [tt]Math.random()[/tt] initializes 1 instance of [tt]Random[/tt]. Then that instance is used in every call afterward. This makes it somewhat more practical to use imo.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:2, topic:282801”]Here is a simple way to do a randomized range:

private static int random(int min, int max) {
	return ((int)(Math.random() * (max - min))) + min;
}

I’m pretty sure I did that right. [tt]min[/tt] is inclusive and [tt]max[/tt] is exclusive.

Edit: Yes, that should work.[/quote]Also, don’t forget that Java comes with a standard class for random. java.util.Random

Random r = new Random();
r.nextInt(max) + min;

I think that should work the way you want.

I wouldn’t suggest allocating a new Random object everytime you want a random number though, that would be stupid.

Read full topic

Here is a simple way to do a randomized range:

private static int random(int min, int max) {
	return ((int)(Math.random() * (max - min))) + min;
}

I’m pretty sure I did that right. [tt]min[/tt] is inclusive and [tt]max[/tt] is exclusive.

item.title: Quick question
item.dc:creator: @Get_Forgotten Get_Forgotten
item.description:
@Get_Forgotten wrote:

Alright I’m not quite sure how to word this question… But if you don’t understand I’ll try to make it a bit clearer

Okay, I’m trying to make a loop timer pause the loop for a random amount of time between 1 - 5 seconds… I’ve found things on Google but they aren’t working like I’d hope… if you know the answer I’d greatly appreciate the help. this is what I’m trying to use, I’ll give an example.

[code]public class bottles {
public static void main(String[], args) {
int x = 99;
while( x > 2) {

          try {
            java.lang.Thread.currentThread();
            Thread.sleep(Math.random(5) * 1000);
         } catch(Exception e) {
              return;
      }  

       System.out.println(x+" Bottles of beer on the wall "+x+" Bottles of beer, Take one down pass it around "+(x-1)+" bottles of beer on the wall ");

    if(x == 2) {

System.out.println('1 bottle of beer on the wall 1 bottle of beer, Take one down pass it around, no more bottles of beer on the wall.");

     }                  
 }

}
}[/code]

Read full topic
